registry.title: Layer Two Tunneling Protocol "L2TP"
registry.note: Unless otherwise noted, the registrations in this registry are applicable in the context of the IETF Vendor ID .

registry.title: Control Message Attribute Value Pairs
registry.note: To maximize extensibility while still permitting interoperability, a uniform method for encoding message types and bodies is used throughout L2TP. This encoding will be termed AVP (Attribute-Value Pair).

record.description: Message Type AVP Also, see Message Type AVP values below
Result Code AVP Also, see Result Code AVP values below
Framing Capabilities AVP Also, see Framing Field definition below
Bearer Capabilities AVP Also, see Bearer Field definition below
Bearer Type AVP Also, see Bearer Field definition below
Framing Type AVP Also, see Framing Field definition below
Proxy Authen Type AVP Also, see Proxy Authen Type AVP Values below
Service Category Also, see Service Category AVP Flag Fields below
PPP Disconnect Cause Code Also, see PPP Disconnect Cause Code Values below
ATM Alarm Status AVP Also, see ATM Alarm Status AVP Values below

registry.title: Result Code values for the StopCCN message

record.description: General request to clear control connection
General error--Error Code indicates the problem
Requester is not authorized to establish a control channel
The protocol version of the requester is not supported Error Code indicates highest version supported
Control connection due to mismatching CCDS value

registry.title: Result Code values for the CDN message

record.description: Call/Session disconnected due to loss of carrier
Call/Session disconnected for the reason indicated in error code
Call/Session failed due to lack of appropriate facilities being available (temporary condition)
Call/Session failed due to lack of appropriate facilities being available (permanent condition)
Call failed due to no carrier detected
Call failed due to detection of a busy signal
Call failed due to lack of a dial tone
Call was not established within time allotted by LAC
Call was connected but no appropriate framing was detected
Disconnecting call due to mismatching SDS value
Session not established due to losing tie breaker (L2TPv3)
Session not established due to unsupported PW type (L2TPv3)
Session not established, sequencing required without valid L2-Specific Sublayer (L2TPv3).
Finite state machine error or timeout.
FR PVC was deleted permanently (no longer provisioned)
FR PVC has been INACTIVE for an extended period of time
HDLC Link was deleted permanently (no longer provisioned)
HDLC Link has been INACTIVE for an extended period of time
Session not established due to other LCCE can not support the OAM Cell Emulation
Attempt to connect to non-existent forwarder
Attempt to connect to unauthorized forwarder
Attachment Circuit bound to different PE
Attachment Circuit bound to different remote Attachment Circuit
Return code to indicate connection was refused because of TDM PW parameters. The error code indicates the problem.

registry.title: Result Code values for the MSEN message

record.description: No multicast traffic for the group
Session terminated for the reason indicated in the error code
No control connection exists yet for this LAC-LNS pair
One of the field values was out of range or reserved field was non-zero
Insufficient resources to handle this operation now
The Session ID is invalid in this context
A generic vendor-specific error occurred in the LAC
Try another. If LAC is aware of other possible LNS destinations, it should try one of them. This can be used to guide an LAC based on LNS policy, for instance, the existence of multilink PPP bundles.

Session or tunnel was shutdown due to receipt of an unknown AVP with the M-bit set (see section 4.2). The Error Message SHOULD contain the attribute of the offending AVP in (human readable) text form.

Try another directed. If an LAC or LNS is aware of other possible destinations, it should inform the initiator of the control connection or session. The Error Message MUST contain a comma-separated list of addresses from which the initiator may choose. If the L2TP data channel runs over IPv4, then this would be a comma-separated list of IP addresses in the canonical dotted-decimal format (e.g., "192.0.2.1, 192.0.2.2, 192.0.2.3") in the UTF-8 charset using the Default Language . If there are no servers for the LAC or LNS to suggest, then Error Code 7 should be used. For IPv4, the delimiter between addresses MUST be precisely a single comma and a single space. For IPv6, each literal address MUST be enclosed in "[" and "]" characters, following the encoding described in .
Next hop unreachable. This identifies an error condition explicitly in the multi-TSA environment.
Next hop busy. This identifies an error condition explicitly in the multi-TSA environment.
TSA busy. This identifies an error condition explicitly in the multi-TSA environment.

registry.title: TDM PW Specific error codes, to be used with 30 result code for the CDN message

record.description: Different trunk types in the case of trunk-specific CESoPSN with CAS.
Requested payload size too big or too small.
Requested timestamp clock frequency cannot be generated.

registry.title: Proxy Authen Type AVP (Attribute Type 29) Values
Service Category AVP (Attribute Type 42) Flag Field
registry.note: The Attribute Value field is a 16-bit field.

registry.title: PPP Disconnect Cause Code (Attribute Type 46) Values

record.registration_rule: Reserved for Private or Experimental Use

record.description: Link Control Protocol (LCP) renegotiation at LNS disabled; LNS expects proxy LCP information, LAC did not send it.
Normal Disconnection, LCP Terminate-Request sent. Valid Direction values are: 1: LCP Terminate-Request sent by peer 2: LCP Terminate-Request sent by local
Compulsory encryption required by a PPP peer was refused by the other. Valid Direction values are: 1: Required by local; refused by peer 2: Required by peer; refused by local
FSM (Finite State Machine) Timeout error. (PPP event "TO-".)
No recognizable LCP packets were received.
LCP failure: Magic Number error; link possibly looped back.
LCP link failure: Echo Request timeout.
Peer has unexpected Endpoint-Discriminator for existing Multilink PPP (MP) bundle.
Peer has unexpected MRRU for existing MP bundle.
Peer has unexpected Short-Sequence-Number option for existing MP bundle.
Compulsory call-back required by a PPP peer was refused by the other. Valid Direction values are: 1: Required by local; refused by peer 2: Required by peer; refused by local
Peer has unexpected authenticated name for existing MP bundle.

PPP authentication failure: Authentication protocol unacceptable. Valid Direction values are: 1: All local authentication protocols were rejected by the peer. 2: All authentication protocols requested by peer were unacceptable or unimplemented locally.

PPP authentication failure: Authentication failed (bad name, password, or secret). Valid Direction values are: 1: Authentication of peer identity by local system. 2: Authentication of local identity by peer system.
No NCPs available (all disabled or rejected); no NCPs went to Opened state. (Control Protocol Number may be zero only if neither peer has enabled NCPs.)
NCP failure: failed to converge on acceptable addresses. Valid Direction values are: 1: Too many Configure-Naks received from peer. 2: Too many Configure-Naks sent to peer.
NCP failure: user not permitted to use any addresses. Valid Direction values are: 1: Local link address not acceptable to peer. 2: Remote link address not acceptable to local system.

registry.title: ATM Alarm Status AVP (Attribute Type 88) Values
Circuit Status Reason values for the SLI message

record.description: No alarm or alarm cleared (default for Active Status)
Unspecified or unknown Alarm Received (default for Inactive Status)
ATM Circuit received F1 Alarm on ingress LCCE
ATM Circuit received F2 Alarm on ingress LCCE
ATM Circuit received F3 Alarm on ingress LCCE
ATM Circuit received F4 Alarm on ingress LCCE
ATM Circuit received F5 Alarm on ingress LCCE
ATM Circuit down due to ATM Port shutdown on Peer LCCE
ATM Circuit down due to loop-back timeout on ingress LCCE

registry.title: VCCV Capability AVP (Attribute Type 96) Values
registry.note: Bit numbering: In this sub-registry, the most significant (high order) bit is labeled Bit 7, and the least significant (low order) bit is labeled Bit 0, see parenthetical "Value".

record.description: BFD IP/UDP-encapsulated, for PW Fault Detection only
BFD IP/UDP-encapsulated, for PW Fault Detection and AC/PW Fault Status Signaling
BFD PW-ACH-encapsulated, for PW Fault Detection only
BFD PW-ACH-encapsulated, for PW Fault Detection and AC/PW Fault Status Signaling
S-BFD IP/UDP-encapsulated, for PW Fault Detection only
S-BFD L2SS-encapsulated, for PW Fault Detection only

registry.title: Bearer Field definition
registry.note: The Bearer field is used by the Bearer Capabilities and Bearer Type AVPs. It is a 32-bit bit field, with current defined bit values of:

registry.title: Framing Field definition
registry.note: The Framing field is used by the Framing Capabilities and Framing Type AVPs. It is a 32-bit bit field, with current defined bit values of:

registry.title: Leading Bits of the L2TP AVP Header
registry.note: There are six bits at the beginning of the L2TP AVP header. L2TPv2 and L2TPv3 share a common registry for the definitions of the six leading bits.

registry.title: Leading Bits of the L2TP Message Header
registry.note: There are 12 bits at the beginning of the L2TP Message Header. L2TPv2 and L2TPv3 share a common registry for the definitions of the 12 leading bits.

registry.title: L2TPv3 Pseudowire Types
registry.note: The Pseudowire Type (PW Type, Section 5.4) is a two-octet value used in the Pseudowire Type AVP and Pseudowire Capabilities List AVP defined in Section 5.4.3. There are no specific pseudowire types assigned within this document. Each pseudowire-specific document must allocate its own PW types from IANA as necessary.

record.xref: "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Downstream External PHY Interface Specification CM-SP-DEPI-I01-050805", DOCSIS, August 2005
"Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Downstream External PHY Interface Specification CM-SP-DEPI-I01-050805", DOCSIS, August 2005

registry.title: Circuit Status Bits
registry.note: The Circuit Status field is a 16 bit mask, with the two high order bits assigned.

record.description: E (Local PSN-facing PW (egress) Tx Fault) bit
I (Local PSN-facing PW (ingress) Rx Fault) bit

registry.title: Default L2-Specific Sublayer bits
registry.note: The Default L2 Specific Sublayer contains 8 bits in the low-order portion of the header. Reserved bits may be assigned by IETF Review .

registry.title: L2-Specific Sublayer Type
registry.note: The L2-Specific Sublayer Type is a 2 octet unsigned integer. Additional values may be assigned by Expert Review .

record.xref: "Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Downstream External PHY Interface Specification CM-SP-DEPI-I01-050805", DOCSIS, August 2005
"Data-Over-Cable Service Interface Specifications: Downstream External PHY Interface Specification CM-SP-DEPI-I01-050805", DOCSIS, August 2005

registry.title: Data Sequencing Level
registry.note: The Data Sequencing Level is a 2 octet unsigned integer Additional values may be assigned by Expert Review .

record.description: No incoming data packets require sequencing.
Only non-IP data packets require sequencing.
All incoming data packets require sequencing.
